alert.note: Alert for Penobscot (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 12:17PM EST until December 21 at 3:00AM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Caribou ME has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Maine... Piscataquis River Above Dover-Foxcroft affecting Piscataquis County. Piscataquis River At Medford affecting Piscataquis and Penobscot Counties. Penobscot At Bangor affecting Penobscot County. Penobscot River At West Enfield affecting Penobscot County. For the Piscataquis River...including Blanchard, Dover-Foxcroft, Abbot Climate Station, Medford...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Penobscot River...including Mattawamkeag, Grindstone, West Enfield, Eddington, Bangor...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Penobscot River at West Enfield. * WHEN...From late tonight to early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, High flows on the Penobscot River cause backwater effects upon several streams and creeks resulting in lowland flooding between Greenbush and Milford. Properties along the Penobscot River could have impacts on outbuildings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 AM EST Monday the stage was 8.3 feet. - At 16.0 feet, river approaches bankfull. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight to a crest of 20.0 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage late Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 20.1 feet on 06/03/1984. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 330 PM EST.
